Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution as a Rwandan Tutsi; identity documents found flawed; language proficiency questioned
Decision_Outcome: Claim rejected; refugee status not granted
Defendant_Behavior: Board assessed document authenticity and language ability
Legal_Standard: Erroneous finding of fact in a perverse or capricious manner
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant deemed not credible due to flawed documents
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 18.1 of the Federal Court Act
Governing_Rule: Federal Court Act, s. 18.1 governs judicial review
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of credible evidence supporting identity and persecution claim
Outcome: Boardâ€™s decision upheld; judicial review denied
Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to persecution not established due to credibility issues
Cause_Description: Applicant's claim of being a Convention refugee rejected due to lack of credible evidence
Evidence_Handling: Board evaluated document validity and applicant's consistency
Evidence_Assessment: Critical evaluation of documentary and testimonial evidence
Decision_Rationale: Insufficient credible evidence to support refugee claim; minor errors not reversible
Legal_Standard_Applied: Whether decision was legally unreasonable or violated natural justice
